file_content.text: On your way. I must complete my tasks on Korriban.
Step forward. I assume you have completed my task; I will take the holocron now.
It is time we judged the purity of your overseers' blood--time we know how much of the ancients survive in their veins.
What does it matter? The ancient Sith are dead.
But why?
It matters because the ancient Sith are the source of our power. They are everything we are.
Indeed.
Uh, right.
You make a mockery of the source of your own power. Pathetic.
The holocron--it glows white. So little Sith blood in all of the Academy... and only one of the overseers wears the red marks.
This is shameful. I will bring this to the attention of the the Dark Council; measures must be taken if the true Sith are to survive.
Sith blood may disappear--but Sith teachings will endure.
You're mistaken.
They are one and the same.
What measures?
I'll advise purges and enslavement of those with the thinnest blood, and uplift the pure. It will be the Dark Council's decision, however.
You must be terrified that the "true Sith" might become extinct.
How frightening for you.
I fear for the Sith as a whole, and I would honor the ancestors who gave me strength.
You have served well. It is too late for me to alter your training--but in the future, perhaps acolytes will kneel at the feet of the pure-blooded.
Find the overseers in the Academy. The holocron will judge their blood purity on its own.
So. Yet another acolyte stands in the shadow of our Academy. You must consider yourself privileged.
Tell me, alien--have you seen much of our civilization so far? Have you been awed by this world's power and glory?
Tell me, you who would be Sith--have you seen much of our civilization so far? Have you been awed by this world's power and glory?
Indeed I have. Korriban is most inspiring, my lord.
Certainly.
You find it so? Then you should understand something.
I'm only a student here. It's not my place to judge.
I couldn't say.
No. It is mine.
Don't talk to me like I'm an acolyte--I am Sith.
Speak to me as an equal.
Are you really?
All I've seen is dust and tombs--not very impressive.
Not really.
Then you have not been blinded by your masters' claims.
Korriban was wrought by the true-blooded Sith millennia ago--our ancestors, a crimson race of conquerors, raised the statues around us.
Over the eons, however, our people mingled with slaves. Now, the red markings of true Sith are rare--and the purity of this planet is in question.
You're mingling with a former slave right now.
I take that remark personally.
Is that so? This is a sad day--but you may yet be useful.
And what about me? I'm not human. I'm not descended from "Sith blood."
What of other species?
The training of aliens as Sith is an aberration--you will never rise to power. It is your masters who concern me.
And what about me? Are you doubting my "purity"?
I'm not in question.
No. You are young; it is your masters who concern me.
Meaning what?
Only if you believe red skin makes you "pure."
I can't agree.
You make a good point. We're a rare breed, those of us who're red.
Agreed.
Red skin is only a mark. It is the strongest indicator of a mighty heritage, but not the only one.
True purity and strength are carried in the blood. I worry that our blood is being diluted over generations.
In the Emperor's name, I've come to learn whether the Academy's overseers are Sith--or not. You will be my instrument.
Yes, lord.
It is a glorious opportunity.
Who are you to judge whether Sith are pure or inferior?
On whose authority?
As an agent of the Emperor and the Dark Council. I will report to them, and if necessary, seek ways to restore hereditary supremacy.
I possess an ancient device--a holocron--that can read and record bloodlines. It will pulse with life near the overseers.
Allow the holocron to fulfill its purpose--stand near the overseers as it attunes to their blood purity. Then return here, and I will learn the truth.
Very well.
Why not do it yourself?
My presence would create turmoil and cause defiance. I have no time for such things right now.
I suggest you find someone else to run your errands.
Get another helper.
This is not an errand. This is an inquisition--a necessary step to securing the future of the Sith Order.
I suggest you work with me. I will not ask again.
I suppose I don't need you as an enemy. I'll do what I can.
Point taken.
A wise decision.
Is there a reward?
You are a creature of greed, aren't you? Very well--a small reward should be enough to satisfy your hunger.
I will be waiting here. Go in strength.
No. [Refuse quest]
You will regret this decision. I never forget a face.
You are little more than a child, but you will grow quickly on this world. Begone for now.
Non-Sith on Korriban. Despicable.
I can't agree.
I can't agree.
Agreed.
Agreed.
